title: DIOGENEIA
content:
DIOGENEIA was the Naiad-nymph of a well or fountain of the city of Athens in Attika (southern Greece). She was
        a daughter of the nearby River Kephisos (Cephisus) and the wife of the Athenian lord Phrasimos.

PRAXITHEA, ZEUXIPPE (by Phrasimos) (Apollodorus 3.196)

Pseudo-Apollodorus, Bibliotheca 3. 196 (trans. Aldrich) (Greek mythographer C2nd
          A.D.) :
        "Erekhtheus (Erechtheus) [king of Athens] married Praxithea, daughter of Phrasimos (Phrasimus) and
        Kephisos' (Cephisus') daughter Diogeneia."

Pseudo-Apollodorus, Bibliotheca 3. 14. 8 :
        "Pandion married Zeuxippe, his mother's [Praxithea's] sister." [N.B. Praxithea and Zeuxippe were
        daughters of Diogeneia.]

A complete bibliography of the translations quoted on this page.
